thread.title: SEO Inc. Joins W3C as a Leader in Internet Marketing, Joins Member Groups
thread.title_full: SEO Inc. Joins W3C as a Leader in Internet Marketing, Joins Member Groups

author: admin
title: SEO Inc. Joins W3C as a Leader in Internet Marketing, Joins Member Groups
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/7/2015 @ 2:57 PM   SEO Inc. 
CARLSBAD, CA -- (Marketwired) -- 10/07/15 -- SEO Inc. is proud to announce its membership as a leading internet marketing agency in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). The Carlsbad, California-based company will also serve on several high-profile groups with other W3C members . 
The W3C develops guidelines and standards for the Web to deliver quality experiences and long-term online growth. "We are both honored and privileged to now be part of the W3C," says Garry Grant, CEO and founder of SEO Inc. "This is a phenomenal opportunity for us to uphold their high quality standards and incorporate them into our SEO services." 
Grant will be joining the W3C's Digital Marketing, Web Security, and Accessibility groups. Grant and other members of the groups will discuss and develop standard practices across the Web to best serve their core audiences. Other members of the groups include representatives for Facebook and Google, as well as top level executives from Adobe Systems. 
SEO Inc. will bring its perspective as a 20-year leader and provider of SEO, PPC, and digital marketing services to uphold and encourage the W3C's standards in every aspect of their business, both their own and their clients'. 
About SEO Inc. 
Since 1997, SEO Inc. has been an industry-leading search engine optimization, PPC management, and social media marketing agency. SEO Inc. has been recognized as an Inc. 500 member, held a global client base of Fortune 500 companies and top recognized brands, and has helped thousands of websites achieve top rankings on the world's major search engines to become the dominant companies in their industry in search and social media. 
About the W3C 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is an international community where Member organizations, a full-time staff, and the public work together to develop Web standards. Led by Web inventor Tim Berners-Lee and CEO Jeffrey Jaffe, W3C's mission is to lead the Web to its full potential. Contact:
